ai.summary: Castle Ward - Castle Trail is a short, easy 3.1 km hike that winds through woodland and around historic castle ruins, making it suitable for families and casual walkers.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily well-maintained paths with gentle gradients. Surface types include gravel and packed earth, with some grassy or uneven sections near the castle ruins. In wet weather expect mud and slippery patches; sturdy footwear is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths. Check weather before you go and dress accordingly. Wear sturdy footwear, bring water and a light windproof layer. Watch for other hikers and wildlife, and respect restricted or sensitive historic areas. Tell someone your plan if walking alone.
recommended_gear: Comfortable walking shoes or light hiking boots
Layered clothing (base layer, fleece or sweater, waterproof outer layer)
Bright or reflective outerwear for visibility
Hat and sunscreen in sunnier months
Map, fully charged phone, and/or a small GPS or compass
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn offer the most comfortable conditions, but the trail can be hiked year-round with appropriate clothing.
